image.altText: CCTV frame shows Erin Patterson standing by the Leongatha Hospital entrance speaking to a nurse, both wear masks.

props.synopsis: A doctor who first alerted police to now convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson describes the moment he grew suspicious of her.

title.children: Erin Patterson labelled 'evil' by doctor who came face-to-face with killer

image.altText: Joshua Brown in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: In a statement released on Tuesday evening, G8 Education says it is "horrified" by the allegations against former employee Joshua Dale Brown.

title.children: Childcare giant to roll out CCTV following child sex abuse allegations

image.altText: An Orange exterior shopfront wall with paint damage

props.synopsis: With a 1,000 employees and about 4,400 clients affected, aged care, disability and veterans care service provider Annecto goes into voluntary administration, leaving staff fearful for their entitlements and their clients.

title.children: Carers, clients 'devastated' as major care provider collapses

image.altText: A white alpaca standing in a field.

props.synopsis: An unlikely hero has emerged in the fight against an "absolutely terrifying" virus which has again reared its head in Australia.

title.children: Why a cute Chilean alpaca named Pedro could hold the key to stopping a deadly virus

image.altText: GettyImages-2224080965

props.synopsis: The Matildas look to bounce back against Panama in the second match of the friendly series. Follow live.

title.children: Grant puts Australia back in front in extra time

image.altText: Michele Bullock gestures standing behind a microphone, with RBA logo behind her

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank had been expected to cut the cash rate to 3.6 per cent, its lowest since April 2023, but instead left it on hold at its July meeting.

title.children: Bullock denies RBA is 'keeping powder dry' in shock rates hold

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair in a hospital with an IV in her arm, which rests on a pillor. She is looking down at her phone.

props.synopsis: There are ways to change the steep cancer trajectories that gen X and millennials might be on.

title.children: If we're to stop the rise in under 50s getting cancer, things need to change

image.altText: A middle-aged man in an akubra and a dark suit walks along a city street.

props.synopsis: ABC journalist Gavin Coote has told a court that he "vividly" remembers speaking to one of the men who has accused MP Gareth Ward of indecent assault.

title.children: ABC reporter tells of meeting with MP's alleged indecent assault victim

image.altText: Four people searching debris on the banks of a river. Debris is littered throughout tree branches.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump describes the catastrophic Texas floods as a one-in-100-year event — a disaster "nobody expected". But a political debate is raging over whether cuts to the public service have played a role.

title.children: Were the Texas floods a disaster 'nobody expected' — or an avoidable catastrophe?

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair and brown eyes smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: In New South Wales, just 7 per cent of sexual assault cases reported to police resulted in a conviction. Lily's story offers an insight into how the system treats victim-survivors.

title.children: Lily's friends shunned her after she was raped. She went to court anyway, and won

image.altText: two man with baseball caps and lanyards, one in yellow shirt, other in black and blue take selfie in front of a 3 tiered pagoda

props.synopsis: Foreign tourists are trickling back to China after the country loosened its visa policy to unprecedented levels.

title.children: China extends visa-free entry to a record 74 countries

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The federal government's economic think tank says Australia will likely be a winner from Donald Trump's tariffs if it does not retaliate and that we would be better off by removing more of the nation's remaining tariffs.

title.children: Trump's tariffs 'actually good' for Australia, Productivity Commission finds

image.altText: Westmead Hospital emergency sign generic

props.synopsis: Less than a week after threatening to leave, Westmead Hospital's entire interventional radiology unit has now withdrawn their resignations.

title.children: Doctors at troubled Sydney hospital withdraw resignations, but concerns linger

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white moustache and beard, white hair, red vest over black shirt with a sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi Walker's family members have welcomed the Northern Territory coroner's findings after six years of waiting for answers. As they mourn the death of another loved one, they say the fight for justice isn't over.

title.children: 'Let the world know': Yuendumu calls for change after coronial findings

image.altText: A rocky cliff overlooking a swimming hole on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: It is understood the child fell into the water at a popular swimming spot in WA's Karijini National Park.

title.children: Child rescued after falling into gorge at Karijini

image.altText: Steven PAYNE photo

props.synopsis: A man who was killed by a shark off WA's south coast earlier this year decided not to wear his shark deterrent device before going into the water, an inquest hears.

title.children: Shark attack victim did not use deterrent device, inquest hears

image.altText: A man sitting on a couch with a baby and his son

props.synopsis: Not having family support, having children with disabilities, and inflexible working arrangements make the school holiday juggle difficult for these working parents.

title.children: 'The messy middle': How our readers balance annual leave and school holidays

image.altText: a stone archway in a paddock with the bright lights of the aurora behind it

props.synopsis: On the side of Tasmania's main highway is a relic of Horton College, one of early colonial Australia's most elite schools.

title.children: This arch is a Tassie landmark, a relic of a prestigious boys' school

image.altText: Hannah Beazley looks to the left of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The local government minister says the Nedlands council will be sacked and be replaced by three commissioners after four councillors resigned, but the mayor disputes the minister's ability to do so.

title.children: Nedlands council collapses as mayor disputes foreshadowed dismissal

image.altText: A large sign of Little Shining Star in a carpark and on top of a building

props.synopsis: An Adelaide early learning centre is under investigation for inappropriately taking and storing images of children's injuries and nappy rash, but police say there is no evidence to support criminal charges.

title.children: Early learning centre being investigated over storage of children's images

image.altText: An emaciated horse.

props.synopsis: RSPCA inspectors collect 131 animals, including 30 dogs at a single location, in "multiple large-scale animal cruelty operations" across the state, saying animal owners are struggling with drought conditions and cost-of-living pressures.

title.children: RSPCA rescues 60 horses on Victorian property as cruelty reports surge

image.altText: Men in high-vis near a crane and other heavy machinery at a construction site.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes as more than 120 employees of the company contracted to build the Olympic trains face an uncertain future.

title.children: Recruitment for 300 train manufacturing jobs underway in Queensland

image.altText: two men hold a flag and one waves while other men gather behind them

props.synopsis: Workers say they are doing it "tough" after the US-owned company Peabody locked them out without pay in response to industrial action in June.

title.children: Workers rally outside NSW coal mine as lockout enters third week

image.altText: Woman getting breast cancer screening done

props.synopsis: Eligibility for some cancer screening programs has recently been expanded to reflect the increasing cancer rates among younger Australians, while other programs have just rolled out this month. Here's what to know.

title.children: What your eligibility is for Australia's free cancer screening programs

image.altText: Profile shot of man with grey hair, a brunette woman facing him and holding his face in both her hands

props.synopsis: Made as a way to cope with grief over losing his wife, legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg's latest movie looks at what happens when technology intrudes on the very human matter of death.

title.children: Legendary 81yo filmmaker processes his grief through haunting tech horror

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with smashed glass doors and a sign that says Miznon at night time.

props.synopsis: Three people have been charged with assault, riotous behaviour and criminal damage after a group of protesters converged on an Israeli-owned restaurant in Melbourne's CBD on Friday night.

title.children: Three protesters charged over incident at Israeli restaurant in Melbourne

image.altText: A paramedic looks serious.

props.synopsis: Speed and driver behaviour are thrust into the spotlight as more tragedy strikes on WA roads, with the latest victim an e-scooter rider who was hit by a truck.

title.children: E-scooter rider becomes latest fatality as road toll soars

image.altText: Men in dark uniforms stand on a parapet surrounded by razor wire at a prison.

props.synopsis: A NSW coroner says it is "extraordinary" that a "young, vulnerable" man who feared for his safety was left alone for a lengthy period before his death in 2022.

title.children: Inmate's death after 18 hours of solitude 'unnecessary', coroner finds

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: Data shows the shortfall of construction workers in Queensland is forecast to peak in Queensland next year as work begins for the Olympic Games.

title.children: Queensland facing 54,000 construction worker shortfall ahead of Olympics

image.altText: Woman on windsurfer in wetsuit and helmet rides a wave

props.synopsis: The world's most talented junior windsurfers will battle it out on the waves off Geraldton — the first time the world championship grand final has been held outside Europe.

title.children: World's talented windsurfers headed for country WA's wind capital

image.altText: a man on a horse chases a cow.

props.synopsis: Authorities are urging horse owners to vaccinate against the virus but organisers of Queensland’s two biggest equestrian sports — racing and campdrafting — say the latest detection is unlikely to disrupt popular events.

title.children: Equestrian events to continue despite latest Hendra case

image.altText: A landscape photo of Hobart's Tasman Bridge at dawn.

props.synopsis: A report by four Tasmanian coroners says safety barriers on Hobart's Tasman Bridge need to be upgraded due to a disproportionate number of deaths.

title.children: Coroners find 'immediate' need for safety barriers on Hobart's Tasman Bridge

image.altText: A woman of Asian appearance sits on a couch in a dressing gown, wiping her nose with a tissue while looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: If you need a medical certificate for yourself or carer's leave, what are your options if you are short on time and want to save money?

title.children: Easiest and cheapest ways to get a medical certificate for sick leave
